description: Topic varies year to year. Topic for spring 2013 Chinese Archaeology This course examines the foundations of Chinese civilization from an archaeological perspective. Excavation and research over the last 100 years has produced a revolution in understanding of the Chinese past, one which has both affirmed and unsettled traditional views. Topics covered include the emergence of early states, cities and economies; technology; the beginnings of writing; ritual and religions; death and burial; and the production and consumption of art objects and luxury goods among the elite. The course readings will be in English.
name: MAJOR SEMINAR ON CHINA: CHINESE ARCHAEOLOGY

section.name: MAJOR SEMINAR ON CHINA: CHINESE ARCHAEOLOGY
